title: How does getting a backlog work?
content: My physics teacher said even if we get 50/50 in internals(ISAs + assignment) but don't get 40+/100 in ESAs it's considered a backlog. Is it overall 40+/100 (internals + esa) or is scoring 40+/100 in ESAs a criteria, apart from internals?

comments.body: If your isas+esa+ lab/assignment/whatever is less than 35 you get a backlog. If you dont show up for esas at all that's also a backlogs.
the minute u have a 40+/50 in internals alone, you're safe, get a 0/100 also its okay. Just be present physically for esa
Wasn't passing marks made 35/100 overall? I read it here on reddit someone had a post about it.
They apparently changed it to 35 for us. Not sure about S&H thoufh.
But if ur attendance is below 75 percent, you wont be eligible to write Esa, so that subject will turn into a backlog then right?
But if ur attendance is below 75 percent, you wont be eligible to write Esa, so that subject will turn into a backlog and the internals will be nullified right?

If you don't write esa, automatically backlog.
But below 75 is bs, unless it's EXTREMELY low they won't let u write, if it's like decent 65+ you can give affidavit, they'll call ur parents to sign blah blah then let u write it
